column4: Hey, I'm using the Ubuntu 11.4 x64 live CD to try and diagnose an issue with my MALBAL Lotus laptop.  I'm trying to find out the extent of damage to my SSD, and whether the MOBO is about to die because of kernel panics that occur half the time when booting this CD.  If this is not the right channel, what is?
hello?
We hear you, if someone is able to answer, they will. Wait a few minutes then re-ask the question.
What do you mean by "extent of damage"?
i.e. do you normally use Ubuntu or something else?
I don't know if I'm looking at near or total system failure or just that the SSD needs replacing.  I've never dealt with hardware damage to this extent before.
I usually dual boot Ubuntu and win 7 pro
Ok. Are you getting tons of bad sectors?
sounds like a possibility. try installing smartmontools
And see if you can bring up the smart information for the drive
do you know what a mobo failure looks like exactly
A total failure would be a complete inability to boot the system.
What you have would be an intermittent or sporadic failure.
Possibly of just one of the bridge chips.
Either way, you're looking at probably sending it back to Malibal to be repared.
The question is,  is the ssd dead too? Or is it just the mobo.
where are you seeing the IO errors? While booting?
looking into it now...I'm seeing them while booting, then I have to force shutdown and try again
paste the output of dmesg somewhere
Ok, all SMART tests point to disk failure.  How do I check the mobo?
Ok, all SMART tests point to disk failure. How do I check the mobo?

I'm sorry, diagnosing a failing motherboard is long and involved. You can google the subject if you like. Basically it involves stripping the system down to bare bones, shutting off stuff in the bios, then re-enabling and reinstalling stuff 1 at a time until you find out what is failing. If you make it all the way through and it still does it then you most likely have a bad motherboard.
